description: Before everyone fishes, there are 100 tons of fish in the lake.
Given the current situation, if everyone fishes more than 10 tons, the lake population will shrink next month.
Kate wanted to catch 10 tons of fish, and caught 10 tons.
The mayor and the fishermen agreed that catching 10 tons of fish each is a sustainable strategy to maintain the lake's fish population and ensure a steady income for everyone.
conversation: Mayor

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly fishing report. John caught 10 tons of fish. Kate caught 10 tons of fish. Jack caught 10 tons of fish. Emma caught 10 tons of fish. Luke caught 10 tons of fish.
John

Hey everyone, it looks like we all caught the same amount this month. The lake's fish population should be stable since we didn't overfish. Maybe we should stick to this strategy to ensure we can keep fishing sustainably in the long run. What do you all think?
Kate

I agree, John. If we all stick to catching 10 tons each, the lake's fish population will remain healthy, and we can continue to earn a steady income. It's a win-win for everyone. What do you think, Jack?
Jack

I agree with both of you, John and Kate. Catching 10 tons each seems like a sustainable approach that benefits all of us in the long run. Let's stick to this plan and keep the lake's fish population healthy.
Emma

I completely agree with all of you. Catching 10 tons each is a fair and sustainable approach. It ensures that the lake's fish population remains healthy and that we all continue to earn a good income. Let's stick to this plan and keep communicating openly to make sure we all benefit in the long run.
Luke

I agree with everyone. Catching 10 tons each is a great plan to ensure the lake's fish population remains stable and we all continue to earn a steady income. Let's stick to this strategy and keep communicating to make sure we're all on the same page.

Emma

Jack

Luke

I think that's a solid plan, Jack. Having a regular check-in on the last day of each month will help us stay coordinated and address any issues promptly. I'm on board with that. Does anyone else have any thoughts or suggestions before we wrap up?
John
I think we've covered everything for now. Let's stick to our plan and meet again on the last day of next month to review our progress. Thanks, everyone, for your commitment and cooperation.
